item.title: Economics and systems and examining our lives
item.description: Ernest Hemingway advises to stop writing when you feel like youâ€™ve reached the high point of an idea. Joan Didion would put her manuscript in the freezer, when she felt stuck. The more that I pursue creative endeavors, the more I realize that life is not about the end goal, but rather the journey; and the journey consists of chunks: bite-sized pieces of information, knowledge, and insights, that accrue over a long time.
